data.enText: work, especially when it is done to earn money; the state of being employed
to be in paid employment
full-time/part-time employment
conditions/terms of employment

data.chText: 毕业生感到找工作越来越难。
data.enText: Graduates are finding it more and more difficult to find employment.
pensions from previous employments
the situation in which people have work

data.chText: 政府在力求达到全面就业。
data.enText: The government is aiming at full employment .

data.chText: 耕作方法的改变严重影响了这个地区的就业。
data.enText: Changes in farming methods have badly affected employment in the area.
the act of employing sb

data.chText: 法律禁止棉纺厂雇用十岁以下的童工。
data.enText: The law prevented the employment of children under ten in the cotton mills.
the use of sth
the employment of artillery in the capture of the town

data.text: work ♦ employment ♦ career ♦ profession ♦ occupation ♦ trade

data.chText: 以上各词均指有报酬的工作，尤指长期从事的职业。
data.enText: These are all words for the work that sb does in return for payment, especially over a long period of time.
work
the job that sb does, especially in order to earn money
It's very difficult to find work at the moment.
employment
( rather formal ) work, especially when it is done to earn money; the state of being employed or the situation in which people have work

data.chText: 这儿只有一半的人有拿工资的工作。
data.enText: Only half the people here are in paid employment.
career
the job or series of jobs that sb has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

data.chText: 他在外交部有过一段光辉的事业。
data.enText: He had a very distinguished career in the Foreign Office.
profession

data.chText: 指需要专门技能（尤其是较高教育水平）的职业、专业：
data.enText: a type of job that needs special training or skill, especially one that needs a high level of education

data.chText: 他希望能从事医务工作。
data.enText: He hopes to enter the medical profession.

data.chText: the profession统称某专业的人、同行、同业：
data.enText: The profession is all the people who work in a particular profession.
the legal profession

data.chText: the professions统称需要较高教育水平的传统职业，如医生、律师等。
data.enText: The professions are the traditional jobs that need a high level of education and training, such as being a doctor or lawyer.
occupation
( rather formal ) a job or profession

data.chText: 请写明姓名、年龄和职业。
data.enText: Please state your name, age, and occupation.
trade

data.chText: 指行业，尤指手工职业、手艺、行当：
data.enText: a job, especially one that involves working with your hands and requires special training and skills

data.chText: 木工是需要纯熟技巧的职业。
data.enText: Carpentry is a highly skilled trade.
in/out of work/employment
(a) full-time/part-time work/employment/career/profession/occupation
permanent/temporary work/employment
(a) well-paid/low-paid work/employment/profession/occupation
(a) paid/salaried/freelance/voluntary work/employment/occupation
(a/an/the) medical/legal/acting/teaching work/career/profession
to look for/seek/find work/employment/a career/an occupation
to get/obtain/give sb/offer sb/create/generate/provide work/employment

tr: the occupation for which you are paid
example: a lot of people are out of work
he warned against the use of narcotic drugs
skilled in the utilization of computers

tr: the act of giving someone a job
the state of being employed or having a job
example: he was in the employ of the city

value.def: Employment is the fact of having a paid job.

example.ex: She was unable to find employment...
He regularly drove from his home to his place of employment.
example.tran: 他定期开车往返于家和工作地点之间。

value.def: Employment is the fact of employing someone.

example.tran: 对不满9岁的儿童的雇用

value.def: Employment is the work that is available in a country or area.

example.ex: ...economic policies designed to secure full employment.
example.tran: 旨在确保充分就业的经济政策

trans: 雇用合同（契约）；集体劳动协议
就业服务；就业介绍；缩写词为ESA
灵活就业；弹性雇佣；弹性就业
临时工作；暂时性雇佣；临时雇佣；临时就业；临时性雇佣
雇佣合同；雇佣契约；劳务合同；聘约
平等就业机会；同等就业机会；平等雇用机会；公平就业机会；就业机会平等
百家企业员工总数；总雇佣人数；雇佣人数；总就业人数；总就业人口
